par.text: Gold is a soft, dense metal, bright yellow in colour. It is exceptionally malleable and ductile and can be rolled into extremely thin sheets,
In terms of hardness it is similar to lead and can be cut with a knife. Gold is a precious, inert metal, untarnished by air, acids or alkalis; it dissolves only in
or nitrohydrochloric acid (a mixture of 3 parts of concentrated hydrochloric acid and 1 part of concentrated nitric acid by volume) to form chlorauric acid
. Gold also reacts with chlorine to produce gold(III) chloride

The metal is a good conductor of heat and electricity. The fineness of gold is expressed in carats. Pure gold is 24 carats. An alloy containing 75% gold is 18-carat gold, while an alloy with 50% gold content has 12 carats. Gold has been known to man since prehistoric times.
